start.title: The beginning
start.text:
What a beautiful (weekday) afternoon!

You are in your garden, drinking a Salvoy herb tea and enjoying the peaceful ambience. The birds are chirping and the sun is glistening on your pond.

actions.text: Suddenly, `Mika`, one of your best friends, bursts through the gates!
"(name), the crystal has been stolen!", she expresses in distress. "You have to help! You being the (job) and all, please!".
"The mysterious blue crystal, from which kyral energy is absorbed to empower our mages, was taken from us! I think the Galbari are behind this..."

options.text: "The Galbari would never do such a thing!"

actions.text: "Come on, (name), are you listening?!". She desperately tries to gain your attention, waving her thin arms around.

`Mika` raises her left eyebrow in suspicion. "For starters, we have been at war with those *creatures* for quite some time now. Also, in the wrong hands, this crystal could have a devastating impact on the tides in our battles."
Mika leans her head to the side. Her arms are crossed. "Do you really think so or are you just saying that to rile me?"

options.text: "Let's just say we don't know yet."
"No, you are right. It probably was the Galbari people."

actions.text: She approves your statment and resumes the discussion.

"Let's go. We need to get to the castle keep. The king has urgent news about the theft."
`Mika` moves towards your garden door, which still stands open from when she entered.

`Mika` hurries out the front gate and speeds into the alleys, taking the fastest route to the castle's keep.
You follow her.
Once arrived at the keep's drawbridge, two terribly tired looking guards stop you.
"Halt, peasants!" one exclaimed halfheartedly. "No entry allowed without a permit."

options.text: "We heard the king has information about the theft of the blue crystal."

actions.text: "Hm, that's about right, ey, isn't it `Lukas`?" says the second guard, turning towards his colleague.
`Mika` exhales sharply, angered. "Let us in already! I'm from the academy, my name is Mika and this here is my friend, (name)!"

The guards exchange uncomfortable looks, but eventually signal the gate master to lower the drawbridge.

You and `Mika` wait anxiously for the bridge to come down.

The great royal hall is devoid of any furniture. Solid marble pillars every ten meters, with guards stationed at every single one of them. Only the king's throne is decorated with flowers.
A couple of chandeliers hang down from black ceiling, bringing at least some light in the otherwise dark room.
The king arises. "Ah, Mika, you have returned. I see you found your *master tracker*?"

options.text: To the king: "Most certainly! For it is I, master tracker (name)!"

actions.text: `Mika` blushes. "Why yes, your expertise as a (job) makes you the perfect fit for this job. You are our best shot", she says nervously.

options.text: "There are probably more capable trackers out there."

actions.text: "Marvelous!", exclaims king `Eral` in excitement. "You, good person, shall find me the magical crystal that has gone missing."
"Ha ha, I see you are a bit nervous!". King `Eral`'s voice is deep and powerful. "Are you up really for this task?"
"Nonsense!", yells king `Eral`. "A person with such experience as a (job) is a reproachless choice for this task."
"Right down to the business, I like it. Eternal glory awaits you for completing this task. And a small amount of 200ðŸ’°, of course."
"Excellent". The king `Eral` is convinced to have found the right person.
Ask away, (job).

options.text: "Any leads on where to start searching?"

actions.text: The king scratches his long dark beard. "Well I am no mage, but it is as large as an infant and looks vitreous and fragile, with a faint shimmer surrounding the crystal."
The king enters a contemplative pose. "According to the latest information, tracks have been spotted north and west from the city", says king `Eral` after a couple of seconds.
"You very well might, (job). Galbari people are no joke, they pose a serious threat to this kingdom". The king expresses concern.

"Alright then. Head out the city gate, then follow the trail either north or west, depending on where your tracking skills lead you."
The king gives you 30ðŸ’° for the journey.
"Unfortunately, I will not be able to accompany you, for I have urgencies from the academy to tend to. Good look, adventurer!"

You head out the front door, cross the drawbridge and make your way to the city gates.
There aren't many people on the streets, only some beggars and homeless care to stay outside during those dark times.

After some minutes, you arrive at the gate. The dirt road leads straight, but forks after some hundred meters. You move up to the direction sign which is posted at the road junction. It states:

â¬†ï¸ Farmino Forest (North)
â¬…ï¸ Hogum Hills (West)

The path north leads you through a sparsely wooded forest. Dying trees are more common than healthy ones. The foliage is covered by fallen leaves, often partially rotting.
Apart from occasional animal noises, there isn't much liveliness to this grim place.
It's getting darker. You are acustomed to traveling through the night, though. However, as `Mika` always says: "Never skip a nap".

You venture deeper into the forest. Despite the lack of signs of life, you recognize a silhouette of a man in the distance, off the road. It looks like he is packing heavy load, with lots of bags. The man appears to be alone.
"Approach, traveler, approach! Have a look at my wares", yells the merchant.

options.text: "You are running your business here, out in these woods?"

actions.text:
"Well for you, my dear, I have ...
Zimbaladong! Where are my manners?! I haven't introduced myself. They call me Jeff. And what's your name?

options.text: "You don't need to know my name."

actions.text: "Ah, hi there, (name). Pleasure to meet you", he says in a friendly tone.
"Ah, hi there, Eugene. Pleasure to meet you", he says in a friendly tone.
"Oh my, that's a ferocious name. Pleasure to meet you nonetheless, Graznock", he says in a friendly tone.
"Oh, you are right, of course. No need for that. Anyway, pleasure to meet you, stranger", he says in a friendly tone.
He smiles. "Well, you are a customer, right? So people *are* getting out here". He seems confident.

"As I was saying, I offer the finest and most exquisite of all the strawberry cakes there are. For 15ðŸ’° it shall be yours."
 `Jeff` shows you a creatively decorated piece of cake.

You have: (cash)ðŸ’°.

options.text: "Can you try it first? I'm afraid it could be poisoned."

actions.text:
"Here, it's all yours". `Jeff` gives you the cake.

Inventory: +ðŸ°
`Jeff` is wiggling in excitement. "Of course you can! Here". He hands over a small portion of the cake.
You can clearly see that `Jeff` becomes angry. His uneven head gets more red every second. "Away with you, you ungrateful person!", he yells.

The cake sample tastes flavorful and refreshing. You sense a strong hint of strawberry. It's yummy.

You have: (cash)ðŸ’°.

"You do not trust a local trader? In times like this, it's already difficult to make a living as a merchant."
He appears to be saddened by the thought of distrust. "Would you recosnider?"

options.text: "Okay, but I want to try it first."

actions.text: "Okay then, farewell". `Jeff` waves goodbye as you return to the road.
Inbetween some bushes and foliage, you settle down and set up a camp. You keep yourself warm at the campfire.
*Crack*! *Crunch*! You wake up in the middle of the night.

There are noises all around the camp. After a closer inspection of your surrounding, you find yourself in the middle of a Goblin ambush!

Goblins: 5
Win chance: average

Success! After a tough fight, you emerge as the victor. Bloodied and weary of the combat, you scavenge the battlefield for loot. You do indeed find a magic scroll, with the potential of summoning a fireball.

Inventory: +ðŸ”¥
Success! You can barely escape the wickedness of a wild Goblin pack. After a much needed rest, you make your way back to the path.

You continue on the path through the forest. The longer you walk, the less trees you see. Eventually you exit the woods.
In front of you lies an open gras field and in the distance, along the road, you can spot a bridge.
As you approach the bridge, you hear a something gnarling and snarling under the bridge.
"WUUAAAAHHHH!!" Out from under the bridge jumps a huge troll! He stands three meters tall and blocks the way across the bridge.
"PAY PASSAGE FEE, TINY HUMAN, OR I SMASH", prompts the troll. He certainly does not try to appear angry, though the volume of his voice is defening.

options.text: "How much do I have to give you?"
"Are you hungry for a cake?" (show him ðŸ°)

actions.text:
The troll answers: "I NEED 30ðŸ’°, OR I CANNOT LET PASS HUMAN".

You have: (cash)ðŸ’°

options.text: "I don't have this amount of money"

actions.text:
The troll says: "NO HUNGRY FOR CAKE, IT IS MONEY ME WANTS".

You have: (cash)ðŸ’°

options.text: "I don't have this amount of money."

actions.text: "NO MONEY NO PASS", exclaims the troll. You stand neither a chance in battle nor in negotiation and must accept your defeat.

options.text: *Avoid troll and continue journey southwest from here.*

actions.text: The troll accepts your fee and lets you cross the bridge. With a lighter purse, you continue your adventure down the road leading north.
Congratulations. You reclaimed the crystal and completed the game!
This game is nothing for lazy people! You are an adventurer. Man up and take the job!
